instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS: What is PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS? PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is 20v in from the USB-C charger on USB-C powered Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Hello, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has No Liquid Damage at all and Will Not turn on...Board reads 19.94V - 10mA to 61mA... Here are some Measurements I have taken with the Board out of the Machine.

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 20V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.39v
PP5V-S5 = 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = -0.00V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0.012V
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> = 0.000V on F300 
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> = 0.000V on F3001
(BOTH SIDES OF F3000 & F3001 Read the same)

USB-C Ampmeter reads 19.94V and goes from 10mA to 61mA and back to 10mA...61mA....And 

PLEASE HELP ?

threads.message: Thank You for Your response 2informaticos.... I Just Noticed <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> for 3.3v SUS Switch is Completely Missing on the Board!! Can I replace <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> from another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board or a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board? I have Both donor boards here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
threads.message: Check if has same pin layout...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
threads.message:
I replaced <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> off of a Donor board and when the board was plugged in it Blew out <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> so I Immediately unplugged the charger and removed the <CHIP>U8200</CHIP>... I am still getting the same measurements as before I put the <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> on...Here are the Measurments on the pads of <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> with it off...
Pin 1 (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>) = 3.2V
Pin 2 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>) = 3.2V
Pin 3 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>) =  -0.000
Pin 4 GROUND

Was it a Bad <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> Chip? It has a Little hole in the <CHIP>U8200</CHIP> chip now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Did you check <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> rail for short???
Never power up a board directly after change a component; think why it was burnt...

threads.message: I Have a Couple more <CHIP>U8200S</CHIP> But I believe your right and there is a shirt on the <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> line....any ideas where in the board I should start to find out what?s causing the short?....I REALLY APPRECIATE all your help :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Inject voltage there.
Start with 1V and go up, maintaining ampers bellow the limit of your bench power supply.
Do NOT inject more than 3.7V in any case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not turning on...No Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Did you hear about Ohm law???
Do you want to adjust V and I at same time, when R is constant?
V=IxR, I=V/R, R=V/I, depending how you like to write it...

Adjusting V, automatically modifies I accordingly; no matters how many Amps you want to have.
